definition: to repeat (one's own words or sb else's)/(in the classroom) to paraphrase what one has learned

sentences.english: Rita repeated what Reardon recited when Reardon road the remarks.
sentences.chinese: 當利爾登閱讀評論時，麗塔複述爾登背誦的東西。

sentences.english: And, again, the husband should listen and repeat her points.
sentences.chinese: 而丈夫還是傾聽並複述妻子說話的內容。

sentences.english: The little girlstudent was reproducing the story in Lesson Three.
sentences.chinese: 這個小女學生正在複述第三課中的故事。

sentences.english: Listen carefully to every word you hear, then repeat them out loud.
sentences.chinese: 仔細地聽清楚每一個單詞，然後響亮地複述出來。

sentences.english: Try repeating people who have British accents.
sentences.chinese: 試着複述有英國口音的人說的話。

sentences.english: Students look and talk about the pictures in pairs.
sentences.chinese: 學生看圖並複述，拼讀單詞。

sentences.english: Listen to the passage and repeat it. Try to be the TV presenter.
sentences.chinese: 小組練習，根據每句提示詞試複述文章。

sentences.english: After a few repetitions, the child soon became word perfect .
sentences.chinese: 重複幾次後，小孩很快就能一字不差地複述了。

sentences.english: What has been your charge for repeating this very plausible story?
sentences.chinese: 你複述這個娓娓動聽的故事，得到了多少酬勞？

sentences.english: Please retell the fairy story in English.
sentences.chinese: 請用英語複述這篇童話故事。

sentences.english: It's a long excerpt from the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 一場戲中需要他複述《聖經》中很長的一段。

sentences.english: Some people restate the job's requirements in their summary of qualifications or objective.
sentences.chinese: 很多人在簡歷中或目標總結中複述工作要求。

sentences.english: The study of paraphrase is about the synonymy phenomena of phrases or sentences.
sentences.chinese: 複述研究的對象主要是短語或者句子的同義現象。

sentences.english: Test suspected liars by making them read alternate versions of their stories.
sentences.chinese: 測試疑似說謊者時，可令他們以不同版本複述謊話。

sentences.english: That is, with the retelling of a relevantand useful personal story.
sentences.chinese: 也就是，複述與之相關的實用的個人故事。

definition: each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
